title: "Can you imagine a League Of Legends movie?That would be awesome!"
body:
Then you realise that your main would probably be of the first characters to die or have barely any screen time in the movie...
https://openclipart.org/image/2400px/svg_to_png/222252/feels.png
#feelsbadman

replies.body:
It really would need to be a TV series rather than a movie. 

I think there is potential so long as there is no main character. It would need to be like Game of Thrones, where multiple factions, multiple characters get screen time and showing altercations between them. I see League lore exactly like Game of Thrones lore but with more fantasy/mythological creatures involved.

Plot wise, i think each season would be an action/drama showing tension rising between factions, ultimately resulting in a season finale Summoners Rift match to settle the scores. Each new season would pick up where the last left off, showing how the world has changed since the last match and new characters would be introduced.

Why not {{champion:103}} vs {{champion:420}} ?
;)
Why are liss veig and vel with the void creatures?
well Vel'koz is a void creature, liss and veig I have no answer for though P:

Because Lissandra wants to bring back "The Watchers"

Watchers have Eyes.

Velkoz is an Eye.

The ARAM event with Snow has nods to Velkoz all over it.

Lissandra supports the void.


Veigar just because he tries to be bad and will team up with the bad guys for ultimate power, betraying the yordles, but will eventaully betray lissandra for the lessar evil (like starscream does to megatron in every damn anime ever).
Half life 3 confirmed

Lissandra supports the Void?

Erm....wat?

http://imgur.com/a/Ikt23

you cant tell me thats not velkoz on ARAM.
ARAM isn't Lissandra's domain. It's just a frozen bridge.
ARAM is the howling abyss, where the Watchers were thrown into, which is where "they are hinting" towards where VelKoz domain is, the abyss, to the void.
But it's not Lissandra's domain or whatever. It's just a frozen bridge where a battle took place. The Watchers and The Void are not connected.

The bridge takes place in the abyss.

Where the Watchers (Lissandra, the last one remaining), were sent.

Velkoz has many statues and is on the red sides gate. They were teasers for him before his release. 

its foreshadowing, its not official, its "just saying/leading to/mentitioning/it could happen".
It was teasing Vel'Koz's arrival. It doesn't have anything to do with the Void being connected anyhow.

This has potential to become so damn awesome that I think Riot is afraid of screwing it up. Perhaps the dream of having this incredibly awesome series possible is better than having an actual series that is fucked up. If they finally go through with it, it must be a huge project, not a low budget money milker campaign.

I've seen things like this getting screwed up too awesome, but I'm really thrilled whenever I imagine a game of thrones version of LoL. Ultimately, I think it's nearly impossible for Riot to picture every champ the way their players want them to be, but it's kind of the same issue when filming a book, so that shouldn't really hold them back. Yes, some people will be dissapointed because their main character acts differently than they thought them to be. Some people are currently dissapointed because the lore of their favourite champ is different than they want to be, that doesn't make lore a bad thing, though.

{{champion:202}} Villain or Anti-Hero? Take your pick

I have actually written scripts about this out of boredom cuz i  was filled with ideas. 
1)**_ The League of legends: The Rise of Noxus _**
This movie shows the background of Shurima and Azir's downfall after being betrayed by Xerath and how Nasus and Renekton prison him etc etc. The movie starts with the fall of Shurima. 
The Main plot is that Noxus after years of development of its deadly war machine sets out to take over Runetera. it shows how quickly Noxus is taking over ,winning battle after battle . 
The other nations  have conflicts with each other that dont realise the threat, except Zilean who sees ahead of time and sees what would happen should Noxus take over. Zilean creates a band of heroes which he calls the** "league of legends"** to set out and unite all of Runeterra and stop Noxus in one deciding battle. Zilean's band includes: Ekko, Gragas, Ziggs, Heimerdinger, Tristana , Ashe , Braum and Lulu. (some of them met along the way) 

Some really awsome moments could be to show some of the characters of the movie like : 
A small town is haunted by malevolent creatures , and the towns Sherriff gives a high reward to the person who catches or kills the 3 unknown but evil figures. Vayne the nighthunter tells him she will get the job done and sets out to hunt in the night! ( spooky !) She is suddenly attacked ( jumpscares) by a flock of crows and fiddlesticks behind them ! No problem for vayne she tumbles aroound the crows and then impales fiddle into a tree ( RIp fiddle) . The Sky then turns dark RED and a deep voice yells DAAARKNESSSS, and a shadowy figure ( Nocturne) dashes towardes her only to get one shotted by Vayne's silver bolts! Vayne then is expecting the 3rd figure and starts looking around. She pauses for a moment and then turns around and kills the Demon Jester that was right behind her. She remains dead serious even though she is happy she got the job done . But all of the sudden in the quiet another smiling demon Jester appears out of nowhere behind her and backstabs while laughing : WHY SO SERIOUS? 

There could be some really cool moments like this .

Ive also thought of a sequel which would be called :
**League of LEgends : The Emperor of shurima**
whhere the heroes  realise that they need Shurima on their side to win the war vs Noxus , and they travel there to rescue Azir from Renektons Grasp. 
But only one person can defeat Renekton. His brother Nasus who is missing for many years. So they set out to find the curator of the sands! But many adventures wait along the way.  ( including getting through Ionia where a war has broken out and Zeds rengade ninjas have taken rule while Shen and akali and their brethren are trying to formulate some resistance. ( Master Yi and Wukong join them along the way to stop Zed, but only the legendary warrior of the wind technique Yasuo can stop Zed and his Shadows. They must find him !) another stop could be bilge water where the story between twisted Fate Graves gp and mf unfolds.( they could throw some shadow isles champions here too) 

The final chapter then is the conclusion to the rise of Noxus
**League of Legends: The Return of The ascendant** ( lord of the rings rippoff the return of the king hehe )
They finally reach Shurima with Nasus who in an epic Duel with his furious brother Renekton manages to kill him and finally set him free of his madness but at the cost of his own life too :( . They then set out to open the chamber to free Azir. But by doing so they free Xerath too. Xerath breaks free and wreaks havoc at once threatenign to destroy everything in his path. But Azir filled with the spirit of vengeance manages to defeath Xerath in an epic duel!
Azir then proceeds to defeat the Noxias anrmy  with his sand soldiers. noxus suffers a terrible defeat etc etc THE END. 
I guess we could have Ashe and braum kiss at the end .
{{champion:119}} Grab some popcorn, folks cause we're about to watch the League of Draven only on the Prime Time with Draaaaaaven
I don't think there's enough overall plot for a movie or a TV series. You could maybe make standalone novels out of each of the recent Events, though.

A tv series or a movie would be just too high quality. An anime series would be perfect as production would be easier and less time-consuming. Plus, the backgrounds of the champions are already there and some lore.

Isn't anime even more expensive and time consuming than regular shows, considering a ton of animes get cancelled or they get a way cheaper Korean team to animate it instead after a couple of episodes, which lowers the overall quality tremendously?
